title: woodcut fonts
content:
i was wondering if anyone knew of any good woodcut typefaces like the one down below. i'm not really looking for the ID of the one shown but something on the same lines thats a good and legitimate woodcut font other than rosewood. if someone could help me out that would awesome.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607im_/http:/typophile.com/files/woodcut_typeface_6453.jpg)
author: schun19

comments.content:
FYI, if that were a typeface (it looks more like a custom plate) it would more likely be metal rather than wood. That's some fairly fine detail for a wood face.

Some sources of 'wood' fonts:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/blinc-pak/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/blinc-pak/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/blinc-pak/")

[http://www.withoutwalls.com/index.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.withoutwalls.com/index.htm "http://www.withoutwalls.com/index.htm")

[http://www.p22.com/products/woodtype.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.p22.com/products/woodtype.html "http://www.p22.com/products/woodtype.html")

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=wood+type](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=wood+type "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=wood+type")
right...i guess i was asking if anyone knew of a font that was similar to the one that says "peter cooper"

[Railhead](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontmesa/railhead/) by FontMesa is fairly similar but with a more ornate fill-in. "Tuscan" was the name of this 19th Century style so try a myfonts search for that.

this might be a useful thread as well:

[http://www.typophile.com/node/12892](http://web.archive.org/web/20150311183607/http:/www.typophile.com/node/12892 "http://www.typophile.com/node/12892")
